conclusion: Plan to analyze the velocity-time graph to determine acceleration phases and calculate the ratio of accelerations.

Velocity-time graph shows Particle A accelerates from 0 to 2v0 over t0 to 2t0, then decelerates back to 0 over 2t0 to 4t0. Particle B accelerates from 0 to 2v0 over t0 to 2t0 and maintains constant velocity from 2t0 to 6t0.
Identify acceleration phases: Particle A accelerates from 0 to 2v0 over t0 to 2t0, then decelerates. Particle B accelerates from 0 to 2v0 over t0 to 2t0 and then maintains constant velocity.
Calculate acceleration for Particle A during acceleration phase (t0 to 2t0). Slope of graph is 2v0 / t0.
Calculate acceleration for Particle B during acceleration phase (t0 to 2t0). Slope of graph is 2v0 / t0.
Determine ratio of magnitudes of acceleration for A and B. Since both have the same acceleration, the ratio is 1:1.
